comments.html:
I'm also very interested to hear your take on the layer-3 routing within Cisco's EVPN+VXLAN topology, as it's one of the few designs I know of that can give us L3VPN-like capabilities on top of a VXLAN data plane.

It's seems to be even more interesting when combined with their slimmed down version of Tail-f NCS for overlay network provisioning which they call Virtual Topology System. I've been playing with it in the lab, and it solves the issue of maintaining consistent configuration and VNI/VLAN management across the local fabric.
